channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Judge demands to know if White House is helping return wrongly deported Maryland man
item.description: The hearing is the first about Abrego Garcia's case since El Salvador's president told reporters he is not going to "smuggle a terrorist into the United States."
item.content:encoded:
The hearing is the first about Abrego Garcia's case since El Salvador's president told reporters he is not going to "smuggle a terrorist into the United States."

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Ximena Bustillo

item.title: Trump signs executive action to lower drug prices
item.description: The action is intended to build upon the existing program for Medicare drug price negotiations, which was created by the Inflation Reduction Act that passed during the Biden administration.
item.content:encoded:
The action is intended to build upon the existing program for Medicare drug price negotiations, which was created by the Inflation Reduction Act that passed during the Biden administration.

(Image credit: Spencer Platt)
item.dc:creator: Sydney Lupkin

item.title: The White House is starting the process to eliminate funding for public media
item.description: The White House is proposing that virtually all federal funding for public media—that's NPR and PBS—be eliminated, starting a process that will reach Congress later in April.
item.content:encoded: The White House is proposing that virtually all federal funding for public media—that's NPR and PBS—be eliminated, starting a process that will reach Congress later in April.
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: Top House Democrat says DOGE data access at NLRB may be 'technological malfeasance'
item.description: A top House Democrat is asking independent agency watchdogs to investigate after NPR reporting revealed DOGE may have taken sensitive data from the National Labor Relations Board.
item.content:encoded:
A top House Democrat is asking independent agency watchdogs to investigate after NPR reporting revealed DOGE may have taken sensitive data from the National Labor Relations Board.

(Image credit: Kayla Bartkowski)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: New Israeli ceasefire offer demands Hamas discuss disarming, but group rejects it
item.description: Hamas is rejecting a new Israeli proposal to pause the war in Gaza, a Hamas official told NPR. Earlier, officials mediating talks had expressed optimism that a deal could be reached within weeks.
item.content:encoded:
Hamas is rejecting a new Israeli proposal to pause the war in Gaza, a Hamas official told NPR. Earlier, officials mediating talks had expressed optimism that a deal could be reached within weeks.

(Image credit: OMAR AL-QATTAA)
item.dc:creator: Daniel Estrin

item.title: Higher ed war heats up as Trump threatens Harvard's tax-exempt status
item.description: The president's comments came after the administration froze $2 billion in federal grants for Harvard after the university rejected what it saw as illegal government demands.
item.content:encoded:
The president's comments came after the administration froze $2 billion in federal grants for Harvard after the university rejected what it saw as illegal government demands.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Elissa Nadworny

item.title: U.S. Army libraries target books with a focus on DEI or 'gender ideology' for removal
item.description: Books "overtly promoting DEI, gender ideology, and critical race theory" are under new scrutiny following a memo issued by acting Assistant Secretary of the Army Derrick Anderson.
item.content:encoded:
Books "overtly promoting DEI, gender ideology, and critical race theory" are under new scrutiny following a memo issued by acting Assistant Secretary of the Army Derrick Anderson.

(Image credit: Patrick Smith)
item.dc:creator: Tom Bowman

item.title: When an earthquake struck San Diego, these elephants formed an 'alert circle'
item.description: When a 5.2 earthquake hit near San Diego yesterday, the San Diego Zoo Safari Park caught its elephants on video taking action to protect their young, forming what experts call an "alert circle."
item.content:encoded:
When a 5.2 earthquake hit near San Diego yesterday, the San Diego Zoo Safari Park caught its elephants on video taking action to protect their young, forming what experts call an "alert circle."

(Image credit: Ken Bohn)
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Rosman

item.title: Dismantling Democracy in Hungary
item.description: In his fifteen years as prime minister of Hungary, Viktor Orban has steadily chipped away at his country's democratic freedoms. We go to Budapest to see what the erosion of democracy looks like and we find that may of Orban's strategies are being studied by politicians elsewhere.
item.content:encoded:
In his fifteen years as prime minister of Hungary, Viktor Orban has steadily chipped away at his country's democratic freedoms. We go to Budapest to see what the erosion of democracy looks like and we find that may of Orban's strategies are being studied by politicians elsewhere.

(Image credit: ATTILA KISBENEDEK)
item.dc:creator: Rob Schmitz

item.title: A colossal squid is filmed in its natural habitat for the first time
item.description: Colossal squid are known to be elusive and likely avoid the bright and loud research equipment used underwater.
item.content:encoded:
Colossal squid are known to be elusive and likely avoid the bright and loud research equipment used underwater.

(Image credit: ROV SuBastian)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie
